generalInfo: Your romantic 12-day Tahiti honeymoon captures the sculpted beauty of French Polynesia and the mountain peaks of green moss that pierce the sky. Indulge in luxury and splendor with private transfers and knowledgeable guides that will immerse you in the culture and charm of the idyllic archipelago. Whether lounging on white-sand beaches or learning to make poisson cru , you can find passion and spirit during this Tahiti honeymoon.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: Tahiti is an idyllic tropical island and is known for its crystal-clear waters, overwater bungalows, and interior jungle terrain. Your fabulous honeymoon in Tahiti will begin with your arrival at Faa’a International Airport, where your private transfer will meet you at customs. You will make your way to your celebrated accommodations and find a suite that hovers above the stoic water of the lagoon. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to bask in the marvels of the island and your gorgeous resort.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Arahoho Blowhole and Belvedere
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your guide will take you on an exploration of French Polynesia’s largest island. You can travel along the Circle Road, which stretches approximately 74 miles around the island’s exterior. On the northern edge of the island, you will find the Arahoho Blowhole, which is known for its rugged terrain and majestic spout that shoots seawater high into the air. You will continue your exploration of the island with your guide. You will visit sites like Point Venus and Papeete Market. Here, you will find the vibrant colors of tropical fruits and the subtle aromas of pineapple and grapefruit.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Waterfall and Beach Relaxation
dayInfo.description: The romance of Tahiti’s natural splendor will come further into light in the morning after you meet your private transfer in the lobby. You will venture to the remarkable landscape that leads to the edge of Lake Vaihiria. A 4WD vehicle will carry you along the unpaved track that winds along the mountains. You will continue in the afternoon to the shores of Papenoo, where the black sand and tranquil waves remind visitors of the island’s volcanic origins.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Visit the Lagoon
dayInfo.description: While Moorea is one of the closest islands to Tahiti, you will feel another world away. After settling into the luxury and comforts of your overwater bungalow, you will visit the fascinating lagoon for insight into the marine life of the island. You will board an outrigger canoe and glide over the transparent waters in search of the captivating marine wildlife. Your guide will serenade you with traditional songs accompanied by the ukulele as you traverse the water.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – 4WD Tour of the Coast and Mountains
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will set out with your guide for a full-day tour of the island’s remarkable bamboo groves, unique plantations, and sensational views. As you travel along the ring of the former crater, you will find the thriving plantations with crops like pineapple and vanilla. The enticing aromas will fill the air under a refreshingly clear sky. You will then make your way to the archeological sites and temples on the island that existed before the arrival of European expeditions.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Whale Watching and Sunset Cruise
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will set out onto the waters of the South Pacific Sea in search of the fascinating whale and dolphin pods. This unique adventure will allow you to bask in the serene setting of the open water before your skipper locates a pod of humpback whales. Once the whales have been spotted (if they are to be spotted at all), you can dive into the water with your snorkel and mask to enjoy viewing the pod in their natural habitat. In the afternoon, you will return to the water on a luxury catamaran for a private tour of the lagoon at sunset.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Stunning Beaches and Luxury Spa
dayInfo.description: You can relax with a romantic day at the beach, beginning in the morning with your arrival along the half-mile Opunohu beach. Here, locals enjoy the sun, sand, and fringing greenery. After returning to your overwater bungalow, you can delight in the romance of a couple’s spa treatment at a luxury spa on the island. The mixture of the tropical atmosphere and specific treatments is meant to soothe your muscles and revitalize your body, mind, and spirit.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Helicopter and Parasail Tour
dayInfo.description: After a delicious breakfast, you will fly from Moorea to Bora Bora to uncover the dream-like island that is famous for the way the water shimmers in four different shades of blue. This picturesque setting will allow you to easily sink into the luxuries of your overwater bungalow. You will venture into the sky on a scenic tour that offers you views of the elegant lagoon. You will wrap around the island during a helicopter flight before indulging in a parasailing tour.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Boat and Sunset Tour
dayInfo.description: You will dive into the water of Bora Bora with a morning snorkeling tour that will take you to the best sites for viewing marine life. You will venture to the coral garden that is known as the Aquarium. In the afternoon, you will board a luxury catamaran for a remarkable sunset cruise that will carry you along Bora Bora’s famous lagoon. The romantic ambiance will stem from the subtle breeze, fiery colors, and luxurious catamaran. The traditional Polynesian music will help set the scene as you enjoy the relaxed ambiance and the natural pleasures of the lagoon.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Cultural Sites of Bora
dayInfo.description: You will set out early with your guide into the beauty of Bora Bora’s inland terrain to find the enticing aromas of vanilla. Your guide will lead you through the fields, where you will learn about how the plant transferred to French Polynesia from South and Central America. Before stopping at a local pearl farm to learn more about the precious stone, you can visit a local art gallery that showcases local artists and themes. You will then reach the family-run pearl farm, where your guide will take you on a boat to visit the line of oysters inside the lagoon.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Bora Bora at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your breakfast will arrive at your overwater bungalow by way of an outrigger canoe. You can ride the canoe around the lagoon as your staff sets up your breakfast for a private and romantic experience. The remainder of your day will be at your leisure to enjoy the island at your preferred pace. This will allow you to lounge on the powdery white sand of Matira Beach. The snow-white beach glints beneath the tropical light, and water laps against the edge of the narrow peninsula.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you at the resort lobby and escort you to the airport for your return to Faa’a International Airport in Tahiti. Here, you will have plenty of time to connect with your flight home.

tourName: Call of the Ancestors: A Moana 2 Tour of French Polynesia, New Zealand, & Samoa
generalInfo: Whether eager to become a Wayfinder or following the call of the ancestors, your Tahiti, New Zealand, and Samoa itinerary captures the wonders of Oceana by following the sails of Moana 2. Embark on an odyssey weaving together the birthplace of Motonui, the stories collected in the Land of the Long White Cloud, and the heritage demonstrated in the cradle of Polynesian culture. Navigate ocean currents over coral gardens and encounter marine life that has inspired generations during an epic adventure across the seas

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Getting in Touch with Te Fiti
dayInfo.description: The island of Bora Bora can feel like an introduction into the world of Moana. Mount Otemanu rises above the coastline, reminiscent of Te Fiti's silhouette with emerald ridges cutting a dramatic figure against the sky. Fish shimmer with the same vibrant hues as the coral gardens and manta rays glide along the soft seafloor. Your flight descends into Motu Mute Airport, and you see the iconic thatched-roof huts protruding from the jungle trees and spreading across the edges of the white sand beaches. Your private transfer greets you at baggage claim and escorts you along the water to reach your luxurious accommodation nestled between the South Pacific Sea and the crystal clear waters of the lagoon. Palm trees rustle in the gentle sea breeze, and you find the scent of hibiscus emanating from the blossoming flora. The remainder of the day is yours to indulge in island life and the comforts of your accommodation at your leisure. You can hear the water lapping against the posts of your overwater bungalow. The windows open to private panoramas of the horizon, stretching to the protruding silver peak of Mount Otemanu. For a fabulous, relaxing beginning to your time in French Polynesia, you take a standup paddleboard onto the water for a gentle thrill, spectacular view, and immediate connection to the life that inspired Moana's story.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Mountaintops and Village Life
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you wake to the sounds of the water brushing against the wooden posts of your bungalow. The soothing sound acts as a lullaby against the silent evening and helps you wake with ease. At breakfast, you may find sliced fruit as vibrant and colorful as the island, with luscious coconuts and mangos easily taken from the bounty of Montonui's groves. Venture out for an early hike to delight in the natural majesty of the island’s landscape and the adventurous spirit of Moana by making your way to reach the summit of Mount Otemanu. The extinct volcano reaches a height of 2,400 feet above the waters of the lagoon. Step into a 4x4 vehicle with your guide and traverse the gravel roads along the protected forest. The wind in the open-air jeep brushes against your skin and carries the scent of hibiscus. The lush jungle passes by as you hear rushing rivers winding along the forest floor. You arrive on the shoulders of the mountain supporting the vertical towers for a rewarding view of the turquoise water, thatched-roof huts, and jade jungle canopy. After descending the mountain, you make your way to Marae Fare-Opu, the ruins of a former temple. Turtle petroglyphs mark two stone slabs set against the backdrop of the bright blue waters.

dayInfo.title: Vahine – Harmony on the Water
dayInfo.description: The morning light washes over the island and returns the gentle shimmer to the water, canopy, and mountaintop. Schools of rays glide around the coral gardens, and blacktip reef sharks circle the reef mounds. If Bora Bora reminded you of the silhouette of Te Fiti, Vahine will feel reminiscent of the goddess's heart. Your private transfer will escort you to the airport for your brief flight to Raiatea where you will continue by boat to reach the private island of Vahine. Coconut palms shade the verdant grass, filling the air with an enticing sweetness. Wood bungalows are decorated with hand-carved furnishings, reminding you that you can bask in the splendors of the French Polynesian islands. For an inviting introduction to the island, you can partake in a Tahitian dance lesson. Your instructor may teach you the basic movements of the hands and hips. The dance helps tell a story, utilizing the intricacy of the costume to the detailed way the body sways. The chant evokes the spirits around the islands, imitating the rustling in the trees and sounds of rolling waves. The costumes symbolize the natural beauty and abundance of the dancers’ surroundings. You absorb the intricacies of the small details incorporated into the rhythms of the dance before you start to move. The drums take on a dramatic beat, embodying the thunder of a storm. A ukulele adds a soft layer to the symphony. You move your hips and find the grass skirt swaying and swishing, easily finding inspiration in the tradition and perhaps finding a familiar rhythm to the "Song of the Ancestors."

dayInfo.title: Vahine – The Water Life of Vahine
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you may find the aroma of coconut drifting through the palms on the shore. The sweet scent blends effortlessly with the soft fragrance of the ocean. Instead of finding guidance in the stars, you can set out into the water on a half-day snorkeling excursion to view the stunning coral gardens fringing the private island. The water can wrap around you with comforting warmth reminiscent of the friendship Moana made with the sea. The salt helps keep you buoyant, floating above the glowing reef. The current helps guide you over the reef near the bungalows to find soft coral yellow tree coral swaying in the water. Table and brain coral create different textures along the reef mounds. The sunlight pierces the clear water, offering visibility up to 20 feet ahead. The coral glistens in the water with the iridescence of a kaleidoscope. Clownfish hide in the fluttering anemones and parrotfish show bright, tropical blues and greens on their scales. The coral twists and turns like knots as it reaches closer to the surface, nearly grazing your legs. Farther away from the shores of Vahine, you can find schools of manta rays floating around the edges of the reef. Their wingspans can grow to a width of nearly 25 feet.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Island Paradise to Thrilling South Island
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can indulge in the view over the water and the aroma of passion fruit or guava emerging within your suite and blending with the semi-sweet fragrance of the ocean. After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you to the airport at Raiatea for your flight bound for Queenstown, New Zealand. Share in a kinship with Moana's sense of adventure and intrigue as you cross the ocean. Queenstown is located on the South Island and captures the natural wonder of the landscape. As the flight descends, you find the incredible peaks of the Remarkables Mountains rolling over the southeastern sky. The waters of Lake Wakatipu shimmer with cobalt hues beneath the open sky bringing into existence an new world Moana could encounter on her quest. Your private transfer will greet you at baggage claim upon your arrival and escort you to a luxurious hotel overlooking the lakeshores. The city can feel like an oasis in the alpines nestled between the snow-capped peaks, beech forests, and tranquil lake waters. The remainder of the day is at your leisure to explore Queenstown at your preferred pace. Walk along the lakeside promenade or take the Skyline Gondola to the top of Bob’s Peak. The cable car travels up more than 1,450 feet above sea level to lookout platforms featuring Queenstown and the countryside during a panoramic view of the natural world.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Darting through the Valley
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will greet you at the hotel and escort you into the wilds of the landscape outside of Queenstown where you can board the boat made for cruising at high speeds along shallow waterways. The adventure pushes the wind past you, whistling as it travels over the boat. The water sprays from the hull, occasionally splashing flecks of the cold, glacial waters off onto your skin. Travel along the protected Te Wahipounamu World Heritage area, passing stunning beech forests and gravel shores. The scent of beech tree may permeate the rush of the wind before you reach Dart Glacier, for which the river was named and that feeds into the waterway. The thick snowfield melts and flows downhill until collected by the winding waters. The boat ay anchor along the riverbanks so you can stretch your legs along the forest floor. Your guide may explain the ancient roots of the forest that date back more than 80 million years demonstrating a stark contrast to the land of Motunui.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Ultimate South Island
dayInfo.description: Venture out Queenstown for the day along the winding roads south towards Milford Sound. The fjord represents the South Island in its pristine majesty, reaching nearly 10 miles from its head to the open sea. You reach the marina and board the boat, instantly finding dramatic, bordering precipices dropping into the glassy waters. The fjord has a resounding silence interrupted only by the sporadic sounds of nature. You hear a seal bark in the distance, noticing a colony sunbathing on the rocks alongside the water. The largest fur seal reaches a weight of nearly 450 pounds. The seals have made a dramatic recovery after being hunted nearly to extinction in the 19th century. Penguins waddle beside the small ferns and smooth boulders shape the shoreline. The rare mainland penguin grows two feet tall with bright white plumage along their bellies. You continue to drift over the reflective waters to find the second-highest waterfall in the fjord, Stirling Falls. The water tumbles over the cliffs at a height of nearly 500 feet, creating a veil of mist along the framing rocks below.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Happiness from a Cultural Welcome
dayInfo.description: Your journey takes a turn towards the region's Polynesian roots. As you approach WanaHaka, the air may fill with anticipation. A Māori warrior will emerge with his Taiaha raised in challenge, embodying the spirit of ancient guardians. The Whakatau ceremony will begin, welcoming you to a sacred space where Māori traditions come alive. You're invited to participate in the Hongi by. pressing noses in a traditional greeting that bridges worlds. The rhythmic chants of the Haka will reverberate through the valley, echoing the power of Polynesian cultural expression before you learn about Moana's deep connection to her island and the sea, referred to locally as Kaitiakitanga. The stories are passed down through generations and resonate with the oral traditions central to Polynesian cultures including Maori heritage.

dayInfo.title: Samoa – Return to the Cradle of Polynesia
dayInfo.description: Enjoy your private transfer to the Queenstown Airport for your flight to Apia on the Samoan island of Upolu, considered the cradle of Polynesian culture. The serene landscape offers an intense natural beauty featured in the radiant seas, emerald canopy, and waterfalls that shimmer like crystals and evoke the vibrant tropical setting of Moana's world. A traditional ambiance continues to overtake the shores and forest embodied in the open-air architecture of customary huts and the quiet charm of the seaside. Your private transfer will greet you upon your arrival and take you to your accommodation on the southern reaches of the island. Fruit stalls showcase ripe melons, bright lychees, and sweet guavas along the roadside. Church spires rise over the swaying coconut palms and you can settle into the marvels of your overwater bungalow offering a view of the shimmering coral groves that embody the peaceful pace of Samoan life, and the feeling you may find Moana sailing over the horizon at any moment.

dayInfo.title: Samoa – Ripening Samoa
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of ripened fruits can fill the air and mix with the semi-sweet fragrance of the South Pacific. The sunlight washes over the white sands along the shoreline and spreads beneath the rustling leaves of the coconut palms. The market in Apia brims with the colors of guava and papaya. Follow your guide on your first adventure in Samoa, which may lead you to the To Sua Trench, which can feel like part of the setting from Moana 2. The serene emerald rainforest runs alongside volcanic rock until you reach the iconic swimming spot resembling a crystal-clear sinkhole. Exotic flowers and jade underbrush dangle along the cliffs leading down to the clear, iridescent turquoise located more than 65 feet below ground. A wooden ladder leads to a platform on which you can relax and enjoy the cool, refreshing water amidst the jungle heat. You may hear the waves splashing against the cliffs in the distance. This may appear to be the world Moana seeks to restore before you continue your day at Togitogiga Waterfall.

dayInfo.title: Samoa – Finding Turtles in Samoa
dayInfo.description: Travel to Apia to dive into the waters of the Palolo Deep Marine Reserve. The radiant turquoise water can wrap around you with inviting warmth. The wake helps guide you to the large fish lingering around the grand coral more than 300 feet away from the shore. Coral carpets the seafloor, leading to a dramatic drop-off. Blue tang and clown fish protrude from the reef, swimming near the anemones and hiding from the passing school of angelfish. A larger fish swims towards you before you realize it is a magnificent gray reef shark. They grow to more than six feet long and often form groups of up to 20 individuals swimming near the drop-off. You may be close enough to see the ridge running between the dorsal fins. When you return to the water around the shoreline of Namu’a Island, off the southeastern coast of Upolu, you can find a habitat that draws green turtles from long distances. The turtles feed in the early morning and early evening, making it a good time of day to dive back into the water in search of the majestic shelled creature. The turtles can weigh nearly 700 pounds and grow to almost 4 feet long. They use their fins to glide through the water as if gliding through the air.

dayInfo.title: Samoa – Returning from Wayfinding
dayInfo.description: The morning may shed light over the secret caves and swimming holes around the island. Locals and visitors often head to Upolu to make their way to the Piula Cave Pools to enjoy the refreshing blue and green waters teeming with fish within the grottoes. Waves roll over the white beaches. A 10-foot long underwater passage connects the two pools and natural slides allow visitors to glide down the smooth, gradual grade into the waters below. You may have time for one last adventure before meeting your private transfer at the hotel traveling to Faleolo International Airport in Apia. You have followed in Moana's path, enjoyed the spirit of adventure, and can embrace one more journey on your flight home.

tourName: Life of Leisure: Perfect Tahiti Honeymoon Vacation
generalInfo: The allure of your customizable 10-day Tahiti honeymoon stems from enchanting visions of crystalline water, tropical jungle, and black-sand beaches. Whether lounging on the white sands of Le Plage de Maui, basking in the grand panorama that overtakes Fautaua Waterfall, sampling traditional cuisine at a cultural dinner, or embracing the charms of a private catamaran tour, the Tahitian islands will seduce you during this romantic getaway.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Day at Your Leisure
dayInfo.description: Tahiti is a tropical island, where exotic trees shimmer along shadowy mountains. Your flight will land at Faa’a International Airport, where your private transfer will escort you to the luxurious ambiance of your overwater accommodation. The charms of your resort derive from the colorful current that gently laps against the wooden posts of your bungalow. You can explore your resort and bask on the private beach that is connected to the resort. You can also venture to the famous Arahoho Blowhole for an introduction to the island.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – La Plage de Maui and Papenoo Beach
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can indulge in the aromas of fresh coffee as it blends with the subtle scent of the sea breeze. After breakfast, you can venture to the romantic stretch of sand known as La Plage de Maui. Here, the stretch of white sand contrasts the surrounding black shoreline. You can continue your seductive day on the shoreline at Papenoo, which is a small village that is celebrated for its black sand. Surfers catch the waves that roll past the reef, and palm trees sway above the bending sandbanks.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Tropical Trails and Fautaua Waterfall
dayInfo.description: You will wake up in the secluded and comforting atmosphere. You will most likely be able to hear the splash of water against your accommodation. Inland from your overwater bungalow is the exotic ambiance of the lush jungle terrain that spreads across the mountainous landscape, hiding unforeseen treasures, such as the spirited Fautaua Waterfall. You can take to the trail and immerse yourself in the sensational sounds, colors, and aromas of the jungle, eventually reaching the fork in the trail that leads to either the Upper or Lower Falls.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Relaxing Day at Your Leisure
dayInfo.description: You can enjoy the beauty of Tahiti from the comforts of your private deck in the morning. As the life source of the island, the trees have numerous uses, from producing monoi oil to rehydrating coconut water. After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you to the airport for your brief flight to the island of Moorea, where you will continue to your romantic resort and settle into the grandeur of your luxurious bungalow that rises from the water. After settling into the welcoming atmosphere of your resort, you will venture to the Belvedere Viewpoint for an enchanting panorama of the northern half of Moorea.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Boat and Snorkel Tour
dayInfo.description: The island of Moorea possesses a pineapple fragrance that stems from the lush valleys in which the juicy fruit thrives. You can spend the morning basking in the isolated charms of your accommodation before meeting your guide along the docks for a private snorkeling tour. A boat will take you along the water, and you will stop along a shallow sandbank for an exceptional perspective of the island. The clarity of the sea will allow you to view the marine life from the boat before plunging in to swim with the animals.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Exceptional Marine Life
dayInfo.description: You will set out on the water with your guide after breakfast for the unique opportunity of swimming with whales. These marine mammals can grow up to 60 feet long and weigh over 40 tons. During the season between July and November, you can travel the tranquil lagoon and observe up to 16 species of whales and dolphins. Your guide will direct you to the outer reefs, where the humpback whale often mates or nurses their young. Your guide will provide exceptional information as both a biologist and cameraman.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – The Peak of Magic Mountain
dayInfo.description: This morning, your guide will meet you at the hotel for an ATV tour to the peak of Magic Mountain. You will leave the shoreline bound for the exotic inland terrain on an ATV. The private road winds along the rugged mountain with a precipitous slope. Eventually, you will pass beneath the lush canopy, where you can find orchids as they blossom among the branches. The viewpoint at the peak of the mountain opens to the water and spreads around the island. Before returning to the resort, you can stop at the Agricultural College for more insight into the beauty of the plants that are native to Polynesian islands.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Catamaran Tour and Dinner
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will board a luxury catamaran after breakfast for a romantic excursion around the bays and across the calm lagoon. You will stop and anchor at a snorkeling spot near the barrier reef. The warm water will feel inviting and cozy as you view the colorful damselfish that move across the shallow reef. Your guide will point out a parrotfish with their ultra-colorful markings that offer a typical but enchanting sight. In the evening, you will dine in an ancient Tahitian village. Your hosts will craft flower crowns amid the aroma of jasmine and introduce you to the traditions of Tahitian tattooing and carving.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Visit the Town of Papeete
dayInfo.description: After a romantic breakfast in your room, you will have a private transfer to Moorea Airport. Your brief flight will land at Faa’a International Airport in Tahiti, where you can settle into the comforts of your luxury accommodation. The remainder of the day will be yours to wander through the delightful charms of Papeete. The Municipal Market overtakes an entire city block, and here, vendors in straw hats display bright textiles, elegant wood carvings, and fresh seafood.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Departure
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private transfer will meet you in the hotel lobby and escort you to Papeete’s international airport with plenty of time to board your flight home.

tourName: Luxuries of New Zealand, Australia and Tahiti Tour
placesVisited: Auckland, Rotorua, Sydney, Blue Mountains, Hunter Valley, Tahiti, Papeete
generalInfo: The iconic will meet inspiration on your customizable New Zealand, Australia, and Tahiti vacation. This tailor-made tour combines the rich colors of tropical paradise, the bountiful culture of geothermal springs, and the cultural splendor embodied in a famous opera house. Dive into the crystal clear sea in search of schools of angelfish, scour a eucalyptus forest to find kangaroos and koalas, and discover the intricate details and history of a hand-sculpted totem in a traditional cultural school. From captivating waterfalls to fantastical hobbit holes, panoramic lagoons to erupting geysers, you will celebrate the beauty of the land and sea in luxury while in New Zealand, Australia, and Tahiti.

dayInfo.title: Auckland – Inviting New Zealand
dayInfo.description: Auckland is a modern city overlooking the ancient, rugged coastline of New Zealand’s North Island. Sailboats drift along the cobalt waters of the Tasman Sea, and the Auckland Sky Tower soars above the sprawling city streets at the height of nearly 1,100 feet. Two harbors frame the narrow isthmus textured with volcanic cones, islands dot the waterways, and lush, fertile farmland borders the country’s largest city. Your flight lands at Auckland International Airport, where your private transfer greets you upon arrival. The aroma of the sea permeates the air, rainforest rises out of the south, and open, verdant hills roll across the north. You take a moment to settle into the comforts of your five-star hotel, basking in the gorgeous view of the water from your private balcony. Quay Street brims with restaurants and shops and the scent of fresh oysters drizzled with lemon drift out of restaurants on the Princess Wharf. You meet your guide in the lobby and make your way through the city on a private tour that will lead you to One Tree Hill. The volcanic cone was once a fortress at a height of nearly 600 feet above sea level, and the site offers 360-degree views of the city and a panorama that includes both seas of Auckland. Your guide points to the shimmering obelisk crowning the summit, and you have a perfect view of this monument dedicated to the Maori people.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua – Bringing Fantasy to Real Life
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the scent of the sea blends with the aroma of freshly roasted coffee drifting out of the local cafés. Delectable pastries fill the display cases along the bar, and locals enjoy the vibrant ambiance and delicious morning fragrance. Your private transfer greets you after breakfast and escorts you south towards the cultural capital of the North Island, Rotorua. En route, you will stop at the celebrated filming location of Hobbiton, known as the Shire in The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit trilogies. The set was designed in the late 20th century to resemble dells of old England. Soft tufts of lush grass blanket the farmland, hiding the small doors of the Hobbit holes. The herbaceous aroma of the greenery blends with the untreated timber spread across the 14 acres of countryside. Step through an emerald door to view the home of Bilbo Baggins, the famous hobbit who helped defeat the dreaded dragon Smog. You feel tiny passing through the door and standing beside the tall chairs created to make the actors in the movie look small. Stand at the hearth where Bilbo and Gandalf discussed the coming adventure before making your way over the river to the Green Dragon, the local inn at which the hobbits enjoyed meat pasties and refreshing ale. You leave Hobbiton but continue in the realm of the fantastical at Waitomo Caves to view the iridescent hues of the Glowworms.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua – Volcanic Images Come to Life
dayInfo.description: Steam drifts off the lake at the heart of Rotorua in the morning, showcasing the intriguing geothermal activity that helped create the unique landscape on the outskirts of town. Mud pools bubble and shimmer in the sunlight. Local Maori women would boil or steam seafood by placing the freshly caught mussels and clams in nets and letting it rest in the natural boiling pools. After breakfast, your guide leads you to the Te Puia Thermal Reserve where more than 500 springs team and gurgle in the volcanic landscape. It is reminiscent of a scene out of a fantasy movie, reminding you of the time you spent in Hobbiton the previous day. The celebrated Pohutu Geyser erupts 20 times a day, shooting water 100 feet into the air. The adjacent geyser, known as the Prince of Wales’ Feathers, bubbles over its silica cone before Pohutu erupts. Vibrant silver and rich orange hues glow along the edges of the steaming pools, shaped by the wealth of minerals in the water. You find a chef standing beside the boiling waters of The Cauldron and watch as he dangles a large pouch on a string, pulling the pouch from the steaming pool. You learn that the chef is cooking shellfish and seafood for a traditional Maori meal.

dayInfo.title: Auckland – Islands In the Harbor
dayInfo.description: The morning light filters through the colorful windows of a local café. Vibrant mosaics and paintings brighten the walls, and the missed-match tables and chairs add levity to the delicious aroma of brewing teas. Woodcarvings in the Rotorua Museum remind you of the intricate handmade textiles and ornaments in the National Carving and Weaving schools inside the Te Puia Thermal Reserve. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you back to Auckland. The city feels familiar in its welcoming activity along Queen Street. You board a boat in Waitemata Harbour and set sail along the famous waterway that splits Auckland in two. The Auckland Harbour Bridge was completed in the late 1950s and stretches more than half a mile and reaches a height of more than 140 feet, and connects downtown with the northern suburbs. A gentle seaside breeze brushes against your cheeks and carries the briny scent of the water, as sails puff in the wind propelling elegant sailboats over the horizon. The skyline climbs above the city, crowned by the Auckland Sky Tower, while the calm, cobalt waters of the Tasman Sea shimmer in the daylight. You drop anchor at the docks at Rangitoto Island, formed by a series of volcanic eruptions lasting more than 6,000 years, and then walk along the winding trail through the lava field to find vegetation sprouting along the edges of rugged, black soil.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – A Historic Life by the Sea
dayInfo.description: The morning washes over Auckland and returns vibrant life to the shops along the Princess Wharf and Queen Street. The sweet aroma of white tea fades beneath the refreshing scent of coffee emanating from Queenies Lunch Room in the Central Business District. Your private transfer greets you at the hotel after breakfast and escorts you to Auckland International Airport for your flight to Sydney, Australia. As the plane descends onto the runway, you view the elegant arch of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and notice the way it frames the iconic Sydney Opera House. You venture to your gorgeous hotel by way of a private transfer, taking time to indulge in the sights around the active harbor. The iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge, standing at nearly 140 feet and reaching a length of over half a mile, opened in the 1930s and connected the outskirts of Sydney to the Central Business District across the narrowest points of the harbor. Your guide greets you in the hotel lobby eager to lead you on an introductory tour of the famous Australian city, beginning in the historic district of The Rocks. The neighborhood overtakes a tongue of land protruding into the harbor. The historic streets became the first European settlement in Australia, beginning with convicts pitching tents along the rocky coastline. More than 100 heritage buildings remain in the neighborhood and showcase the sandstone bricks and iron chimneys of the 19th century. Your guide leads you to Cadman’s Cottage, the oldest surviving home in Sydney, erected in 1816. The aroma of fresh macaroons and sourdough pretzels drifts out of the contemporary outdoor shopping district that revitalized the historic buildings with new, refreshing, and cosmopolitan life.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Enjoying the Breeze of Sydney Harbour Life
dayInfo.description: Chic and bohemian locals make their way to the trendy coffee shops in the morning to enjoy a refreshing morning beverage and a sweet pastry. A 19th-century pie house now holds a roaster and bakery intent on providing patrons with unforgettable flavors that shift the conversation from historical teas to the delicate and delectable layers of coffee. After an early breakfast, you venture to the docks of Darling Harbour to board a luxurious boat bound for the glistening water. You weigh anchor and glide gently onto the celebrated waterway connecting suburban canals to the Central Business District. Stand on the aft and enjoy the soft sea breeze brushing over the boat. Looking back at the city you can spot the iconic sails of the Sydney Opera House, and the stunning skyline crowned by the Sydney Tower, the city’s tallest building, shimmering with a golden spire. The boat passes near Taronga Zoo and the glittering white sands along Little Sirius Cove. Upon returning to Darling Harbour, you find the brick esplanade leading to the Opera House. Your guide greets you in the shade cast by the gorgeous rooftop meant to imitate the sails of the boats effortlessly cruising past on the water.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – A Distinctive Blue
dayInfo.description: The artistic neighborhood of Surrey Hills wakes up to the scent of award-winning coffee drifting out of the neighborhood café, which has strengthened the coffee drinking culture of the city. Art galleries and murals decorating the brick walls of antique buildings add to the artistic ambiance along the avenues and hidden lanes. After breakfast, you make your way out of the city to reach the borders of the Blue Mountains National Park where the aroma of eucalyptus from the surrounding forest hangs in the air. In the morning light, the leaves cast a blue hue over the canopy, accounting for the name of the protected area that contains waterfalls, ravines, and more than 80 miles of hiking trails. Sandstone cliffs ascend above the forest-clad Jamison Valley, and the golden and rust-colored striations on the rocks contrast the emerald treetops. For an elaborate view of the landscape, your first stop is Echo Point, a clifftop platform that overlooks the Three Sisters. The ravine ridges run along the background with trees carpeting the crests and hills, while in the foreground the sandstone karsts known as the Three Sisters capture your attention. The pillars rise nearly 3,000 feet above the floor of the Jamison Valley and were created by erosion due to wind and rain. If you feel adventurous, you can follow the Giant Stairway which winds down the precipice and connects the peaks to the basin by more than 800 steps.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – From the Active Water to the Relaxing Wine
dayInfo.description: Enjoy an early breakfast before making your way to the shores of Bondi Beach. Locals jog, walk and exercise along the promenade in the cool morning air. The scent of coffee and tea emanates from the sleepy cafes hidden behind the main street overlooking the water. Surfers take to the waves and carve the breakwater crashing near the rocks away from the powdery white sand. As the day grows warmer, more people venture to Bondi Beach to relax in the hot Australian sun and to cool off in the refreshing, turquoise waters. The shop windows along Campbell Parade present fashionable clothing displays and lead to the charming outdoor seating of the local cafes. The Coogee to Bondi Coastal Walk wraps around the beach and offers spectacular vistas from which to take in the famous coastline of New South Wales and Sydney. You continue your exploration of the delightful Australian state as your private guide leads you to Hunter Valley, the oldest wine region in Australia. Narrow lanes filled with vintage shops crisscross the heart of the valley, and premium wineries grow vines across the fertile and lush landscape leading to the foothills of dramatic mountain peaks. You take your time noticing the boutique chocolate shops and grazing sheep before stopping at a celebrated vineyard known for producing wine, cheese, and olives.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – One Step to Paradise
dayInfo.description: George Street brims with life in the returning sunlight. The oldest street in Australia flickers with antique architecture, including the late 19th-century architectural medley of Sydney Town Hall and the oldest shopping arcade in the city, Queen Victoria Building. The Romanesque design gives way to opulent stained glass windows, and more than 20 small domes surround the larger dome, which acts as a centerpiece of the building’s interior. More than 200 high-end boutique shops continue to decorate the windows with featured displays amidst the mosaic floors. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you to Sydney International Airport for your flight east to tantalizing Tahiti. Emerald foliage drapes over volcanic peaks, contrasting the azure lagoon and indigo sea, black sand beaches glisten beneath the elegant waving fronds of coconut palms, and the aroma of hibiscus flowers overtakes the semi-sweet scent of the South Pacific Sea. Your private transfer greets you upon arrival at Faaa International Airport, leading you to the comforts of your luxurious resort. You find the fragrance of fresh coconut soothing after the flight from Australia. The views from your overwater bungalow look out onto the water quietly lapping against the posts and the tropical garden blossoming with orchids and frangipani. When you are ready, venture next to the Lagoonarium for an introduction to the exotic beauty of the tropical sea. The natural lagoon enclosure frames the reef where angelfish and parrotfish glow alongside the coral in the crystal clear waters.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Adventures in Tahiti
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of pineapple and coconut drift through the open windows of your overwater bungalow. You listen to the waters gently breaking against the wooden posts supporting your suite, and enjoy the sweet, lingering scent of blossoming frangipani. You meet your guide in the lobby and begin your excursion into the heart of the French Polynesian island, passing through the perfume of coconut milk and grilling fish. Coconuts dangle from the palms in collected bunches. Women wear bright, hand-dyed sarongs glowing with the tropical colors of the island, and the lagoon shimmers with ultramarine hues against the rolling hills of vibrant, green trees. You catch the scent of hibiscus in the breeze blowing through the open-air vehicle. The jeep splashes through a shallow river, causing drops of cool water to reach your skin amidst the tropical heat before you step onto a path winding beneath the gigantic ferns and lush canopy. You can hear the echoing sounds of crashing water, and you find a sharp peak in the background framing the more than 440-foot tall Fautaua Waterfall. The stunning whitewater rushes down the mountainside into the Fautaua Valley, and the thick stream brushes past promontories, splashing into the waiting pool below. The water billows upwards with a cool, rejuvenating mist contrasting the warm golden sunlight.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – French Polynesian Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the market at the heart of Papeete shines with the striking colors of handmade sarongs and shimmering shell necklaces. Woven hats help locals and visitors protect their skin from the tropical sunlight, and fishmongers present their largest, tastiest seafood from the day’s earlier catch. The scent of passion fruit and guava emanates from the juicers making fresh, delicious fruity combinations and local ice cream. The pearl shops on the upper floors display elegant, polished black pearls reminiscent of priceless treasure. The day is yours to embrace the splendors of Tahiti at your leisure, where you can spend time enjoying the art of the Gauguin Museum or lounging on the ebony sands of Papenoo Beach. Board a luxury catamaran to set sail to an old plane wreck. The crystal clear sea glistens with shades of turquoise, and you leap into the water and let the warm, briny texture embrace you. Blue tangs swim along the coral garden rising out of the seafloor, while a school of humbug damselfish circles in your shadow; their black and white stripes remind you of a herd of zebras. The stretch of coral leads you to a small airplane that sunk into the sea decades ago. Outside of the water, the salt begins to form crystals on your shoulders. The rainbow of tropical fish, from clownfish to parrotfish, continues to streak past you, and you can see the nearly intact Cessna plane that lays on the seafloor 20 feet below the surface.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Returning from the South Pacific
dayInfo.description: The scent of fresh and frothy cappuccino overtakes the sweet coconut aroma on your final morning in Tahiti. The nearly 340 acres of botanic gardens create a tranquil, secluded inland escape from the lapping waters and black-sand shores around Tahiti. Banyan and palm trees shade the walking paths, grapefruits dangle from the canopy, and ponds trickle against the pebbled banks. The history of French Polynesia, along with the culture of island life, is on display in the Tahiti and Islands Museum in Papeete overlooking the west coast. The galleries present images of the geography, natural history, and a view to the surfers gliding across the waves around one of the island’s most popular surf destinations. After breakfast, your private transfer greets you at the hotel and escorts you to Faaa International Airport for your flight home.

generalInfo: Discover the grandeur of French Polynesia that stems from the natural beauty of the lush jungle, towering mountains, and pristine waters during this 7-day Tahiti honeymoon. The serene ambiance of the tropical wonderland creates the perfect romantic setting, in which you can indulge in classic beaches and enjoy unique active excursions. From pearl farms to snorkeling and from overwater bungalows to waterfalls, uncover the tremendous charms and endless romance of Tahiti.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – The Celebrated Beaches
dayInfo.description: The bountiful beauty of Tahiti stems from the tropical jungle and crystalline waters of the lagoon. The aroma of coconut lingers around the island landscape and stems from the palms that line the coastline. Your flight will land at Faa’a International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you at customs and transfer you to your luxurious resort. You will have time to bask in the comforts of your overwater bungalow before beginning a spirited exploration of Tahiti’s gorgeous beaches at Point Venus. Here, the soft, ashy, and black sand along the shoreline stems from the volcanic origins of the island.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – The Treasures of Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you can bask in the mixture of sweet and savory flavors. Your guide will meet you after your meal to lead you on a tour of the Papenoo Valley in search of waterfalls. You will board your 4WD vehicle and venture into the marvelous jungle terrain. Your guide will also lead you along winding tracks through the lush valley. You will splash across shallow riverbeds before arriving at the first major cascade of your excursion: Topatari Falls. You can wade through the shallow water to reach the base of the falls, where you can find lush ferns and delicate moss that overtakes the rocky outcroppings.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Romantic Snorkeling Tour
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will meet your guide at the hotel and board a boat that is bound for the beauty of the turquoise lagoon. Today, you will be going on a private snorkeling tour. You will venture to the celebrated spot of Sharks Sandbank. The water remains shallow and warm throughout the day in addition to hosting blacktip reef sharks that can reach over four feet long. The sharks feed primarily on reef fish, crustaceans, mollusks, and cephalopods. After discovering the thrills and charms of marine life, you will continue exploring the island.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Private Tahitian Dance Lesson
dayInfo.description: In the morning, your private transfer will escort you from your resort to the airport for your flight to the island of Raiatea. Here, you will continue by boat to your resort on the stunning island of Taha’a. The boat ride will highlight the marvels of the sea as you approach the shores of the secluded island that glints with the emerald hues of a tropical jungle. You will settle into the comforts of your overwater bungalow before meeting your instructor in the afternoon for a private lesson in Tahitian dance. A drummer and ukulele player will help bring the proper sounds to the lesson as you learn the different ways to wear the pareo , which is a traditional wraparound skirt.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Jungle and River Kayak Tour
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, the aromas of vanilla and hibiscus will return. You will meet your guide for an introduction to the beauty of the islands with a private kayak tour on the Faaroa River. The excursion will lead you through Raiatea, which features the history and legends of the island. You will stop along a clearing near the water to enjoy a picnic among the exotic scenery. After lunch, you will return to the resort with the remaining day at your leisure to indulge in the splendors of Taha’a.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Encounter Island and Lagoon Life
dayInfo.description: You will set out in the morning for a full-day tour of Taha’a island, beginning with a snorkeling excursion at one of the island’s best marine life destinations. Your guide will instruct you on the kinds of fish you will see before you plunge into the water. You will then continue to a pearl farm to learn more about the elegant gem that stems from the mouth of an oyster or mussel. Your guide will lead you to the water to view a submerged rope on which oysters cling to produce the delicate pearls that take up to 24 months to produce.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Departure
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you will find the sweet scent of vanilla as it fills the air. After breakfast, your private driver will transfer you to Tahiti’s Faa’a Airport, where you will make the connection to your outbound flight.

tourName: Romantic 8-Day Honeymoon Vacation to Tahiti and Bora Bora
generalInfo: Indulge in the luxuries of French Polynesia during this 8-day Tahiti honeymoon. Private tours and the secluded ambiance of overwater bungalows immerses you in the romance of Tahiti and Bora Bora. Here, you can celebrate passion in tropical paradises. From a private surf lesson to witnessing migrating humpback whales, this tour allows you to bask in the beauty of natural waterfalls and white-sand beaches.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Arrive and Day at Your Leisure
dayInfo.description: The island of Tahiti has a quiet, inviting ambiance that stems from the tropical lagoons and jungle canopy that hides exceptional waterfalls. Your flight will land at Faa’a International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you at customs. You will have the remainder of the day to settle in to the comforts of your accommodation above the water of the lagoon. Your suite will afford you a glass-bottom view of marine life. For an exceptional introduction to Tahiti, you can venture to the Belvedere, which is the starting point for the hike that leads to the peak of Mt. Aroai.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Private Waterfall Tour
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will introduce you to the stunning cascades of Tahiti on a private tour. You will begin with a 4WD excursion into the heart of the jungle terrain at Papenoo Valley. Your tour will lead you on a search for the three falls of Topatari, Vaiharuru, and Puraha. Your guide will stop between the major waterfalls so that you can find natural pools and blossoming wildflowers that capture the tropical atmosphere for which Tahiti is known.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Surf Lesson and Visit Papeete
dayInfo.description: Before beginning your private surf lesson, you can sample the local juice made from noni , which is a local fruit that is associated with natural health benefits. You will meet your instructor on the beach for a private surf lesson. Soon, you will plunge into the water to try and catch your first wave. As the waves coil and splash, your instructor will offer guidance along the way to ensure that you can stand on the board while riding the wave. In the capital city of Papeete, you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure to explore the unique culture of Tahiti.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Petroglyphs and Maraa Grotto
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you after breakfast to show you the culture of Tahiti, beginning at the fascinating petroglyphs of Te Pari. The rugged coastline at the southern point of Tahiti Nui rings with powerful waves that crash against the coastline. The preserved petroglyphs are etched into the volcanic boulders and are speckled with vibrant moss. You will then venture deeper into the untouched corners of Tahiti to find Maraa Grotto, which is a natural wonder that is hidden by the thriving ferns of the rainforest terrain.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Relax on the Beaches
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will escort you to the airport after breakfast for a brief flight to the island of Bora Bora. You will continue to your resort with a private transfer before settling in to the comforts of your overwater bungalow. You will have a private view that overlooks the ocean. After taking time to enjoy the luxuries of your resort, you will visit the marvelous coastline of Bora Bora at Matira Beach. The white sand stretches for about a mile at the southern tip of the island. At low tide, you can walk to Matira point to view the barrier reef as it is magnified by the glossy shallow water.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Snorkeling Tour and Photo Shoot
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will meet your guide to begin your snorkeling tour. This excursion will allow you to visit some of the most dazzling destinations around Bora Bora. Around the mounds of vibrant coral, you can find blue tang. After discovering some of the marine life around Bora Bora’s reef, you will have a photo shoot that will capture the spirit of the island and the magic of your vacation. Your private photo shoot will take place around the lagoon and your resort.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Whale Watching and Island Excursion
dayInfo.description: You will set out on a boat in the morning that is bound for the open water. Today, you will be in search of the wildlife of the South Pacific Sea. The migration season for humpback whales in French Polynesia occurs between July and mid-November. Your guide will offer information about the whales, how they migrate up to 16,000 miles each year, and how you can notice their giant size that averages 52 feet long. You will return to land and embark on a 4WD excursion that will take you to the lookout at Faanui Canon.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Departure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the pearl market on Bora Bora opens its doors. After a delicious breakfast, your private transfer will greet you at your resort and escort you to the Bora Bora Airport for your return flight to Tahiti, where you will connect with your flight home.

tourName: Romantic Tahiti Honeymoon With Bora Bora
placesVisited: Motu Tautau, Bora Bora, Pape'ete, Mo'orea
generalInfo: Sapphire lagoons and tropical cocktails, waterfalls tumbling towards white sand beaches and bungalows perched above turquoise waters will all move from your imagination to your reality as you escape into enchantment. Go for days without the need for shoes or time, as this Tahiti and Bora Bora honeymoon brings solitude and intimacy on four of the world’s most romantic tropical islands. Pull yourself from the indulgence, and there is also adventure to find, with private escapades and experiences on these surreal volcanic islands.

dayInfo.title: Papeete – An Indulgent Welcome to the South Seas
dayInfo.description: From the plane window of your plane, you can glimpse the tropical beauty with snippets of white sand and volcanic hills cast adrift in the South Pacific. Disembark the plane, and the views are magnified with a rainbow of greens and blues blurring together. Check into your room with a panoramic view at the Intercontinental Tahiti Resort, and it will seem that these colors extend for eternity, a perfect backdrop for your days of romance in the South Seas. Such vistas naturally lend themselves to a feeling of relaxation, and regardless of how long it took to reach Tahiti, within an hour of landing, you will appreciate that it was worth traveling to the end of the world. The resort has two restaurants, and three bars tucked away in 30 acres of private gardens on the coast and has long been rated as the best hotel on the island of Tahiti. Over the next ten days, you will grow accustomed to the rhythm of the islands, one that is not marked by time but rather by pleasure. There is no need for your watch, no requirement to stay connected on Wi-Fi, and on this first day, an insight into local culture will help you to feel at home in this alternative way of life. It will not be the setting and the indulgent resort that creates a laid-back rhythm, as while the white sand and turquoise waters obviously help in this regard, the atmosphere has its roots in the people of these islands. Their culture has always been one that favors tranquility and indulgence, and through a handful of local connections and cultural demonstrations, you will completely slow your pace. Tahiti is not just a Westernized fiction in the South Pacific, but a way of life that has always enabled escapism to thrive.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – The Iconic Pacific Island: White Sand, Vertical Mountains, Tropical Lagoons
dayInfo.description: Papeete is a gateway and the ideal introduction to the charms of the South Pacific. This morning you will travel onwards on a luxury catamaran that will traverse the islets and colors of the archipelago. It takes just 30 minutes to reach Moorea, an island that soars majestically out of the ocean. The island’s volcanic peaks are carpeted in velvet green, the forests and fern-softened cliffs interspersed with the poetic threads of waterfalls. A wide, shallow lagoon is back-dropped by this magnificent scene, the drama of nature standing over the tranquility of the ocean. You will be transferred from the pier to the InterContinental Moorea Resort & Spa, where you are staying in a premium beach junior suite bungalow. Situated on the white sand and shaded by a canopy of coconut palms, the bungalows are isolated from the rest of the resort. Relaxed terraced dining and cocktails are found on this side of the resort so that you can spend the each day within a short white-sand arc of your bungalow. There is absolutely no need for shoes here as the sand is soft and gentle beneath your feet. Gaze back, and the island’s massif rises evocatively; gaze out and the colors of the lagoon swirl below, beckoning you forward. In this sense, Moorea epitomizes the theme for this honeymoon. You can spend the days in the solitude of the turquoise setting, but you can also add on some adventures across the island.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Customizing a Dream Program on the Island of Moorea
dayInfo.description: Wake to the sound of softly lapping waters as shards of sunlight seep into your room. Fresh smells await you on the balcony, from breakfast coffee to the salt that flickers off the ocean’s surface. Take a walk onto the beach, and there are few other footprints, nor are there other beach towels beneath the island’s volcanic backdrop. Spend time in the on-site spa, swim through the waters of the infinity pool to a bar, and drift away on the lagoon’s soft current as Moorea is famed for its gentle, warm waters. This resort is handpicked as it offers Moorea’s widest range of activities, providing adventures for two on both land and water. Paddle away in a double kayak or canoe, following the shoreline to slithers of sand unbeknown to the world. The island has virtually no roads, so when you paddle in the opposite direction to the pier, it is easy to escape into a place where there is absolutely nobody else. Guided jeep tours are not quite as tranquil, but have a similar feeling of escapism. Bumping along rutted trails you will rise across these fern-covered slopes to mystical waterfalls and jagged volcanic escarpments. The views from up here are legendary, and as the wilderness envelops, you will discover that a South Seas honeymoon offers more than just the fairytale images of the coast.

dayInfo.title: Motu Tautau – The Ultimate Tahitian Hideaway
dayInfo.description: Fly across the archipelago with isolated reefs and islets scattered beneath the wing tips. Your destination is Motu Tautau, an islet found between the lush colors of Taha’a Island and the silhouette of Bora Bora island. An air of tradition greets you with Le Taha’a Island Resort & Spa inspired by classic Polynesian design. This is a place of harmony, the resort blending into both the landscape and the local culture. You will be spending two nights in a Taha’a Overwater Suite, literally perched over the turquoise and sapphire waters of the Pacific, accessed by a winding wooden walkway that affords you a heightened level of privacy. As with all of the other islands, the experience can be twofold. It is a dreamy honeymoon for many of your hours here, as silence reigns and the ocean reveals its renowned pleasures. For much of these two days, Motu Tautau is the image of a South Pacific honeymoon, complete with sprinklings of local culture, treatments in the spa, drinks, and food delivered to the room. But dive beneath the surface, and tropical reefs await. Snorkel across the waters, and new colors emerge. Walk across the islet, and strange flora spirals high above your head. You can do nothing, and that is always an appeal, but when you do something, anything, the setting makes the experience magnificent.

dayInfo.title: Motu Tautau – Private Four-Wheel Drive Adventure Across Volcanic Taha’a Island
dayInfo.description: A four-wheel drive excursion across Taha’a will inject energy into your island getaway. You will enjoy a private tour, bumping across volcanic hills that rise in bizarre formation. At first, you will ascend, the vehicle climbing slowly towards the rocky summits and polychromatic escarpments. From here, the views are sublime as down towards the turquoise bays and your islet home in the Pacific. Then disappear into the bush, and your guide will give you some time to explore alone, all of your senses aroused by the atmosphere in this wilderness on the edge of the world. Continuing the four-wheel drive tour, you will taste local fruits and explore a vanilla plantation before descending to a pearl farm and empty beach. After the morning tour, the afternoon is at your leisure, and it will feel even more indulgent as your mind still races from images of the volcanic hills.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – The World’s Ultimate Romantic Escape
dayInfo.description: Now on to Bora Bora, nature’s ode to love. Mount Otemanu pierces the sky, and you will glimpse it from the plane window, a dramatic backdrop to the serenity of the island. Touch down, and an artist’s palette of blues and greens swirl before you, the kaleidoscope just one reason Bora Bora has been proclaimed the most “romantic island in the world.” It is a short transfer to the InterContinental Bora Bora Resort & Thalasso Spa, an accommodation made unique by the view towards Mount Otemanu. Your suite has a traditional facade but a contemporary interior, with a floor-to-ceiling front window overlooking the lagoon, beach, and mountain. The islands of the South Pacific each have their settings, and that of Bora Bora is this green mountain backdrop that is in the foreground when staying at the InterContinental Bora Bora Resort & Thalasso Spa.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Serenity and Solitude in a Suite Above the Water
dayInfo.description: Just as on Motu Tautau, your suite stands over the water and is accessed only by a walkway above the Pacific. With its secluded location and spacious design, it seems to come straight from the boutique honeymoon brochures. A few steps away, you will find a virgin beach, completely inaccessible to anyone not staying at the resort. You will be on the eastern side of Bora Bota, known as Motu Piti Aau, an area that is only reachable by boat. Water activities like kayaking and snorkeling can be interspersed with the serenity of your stay. Upon land, it is possible to take an adventure towards the green cliffs of Mount Otemanu while the resort’s Deep Ocean Spa is one of the finest in the whole of the South Pacific. Perhaps the best angle of all is the suite itself, the peace and harmony of sitting back in the living area with your partner, watching the mountain slowly cast its afternoon shadow across the waters.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Departure
dayInfo.description: The InterContinental Bora Bora Resort & Thalasso Spa is conveniently located for your international departure. After breakfast and a late checkout, it is just a short boat transfer to the airport and your Air Tahiti flight from Bora Bora back to Papeete. Here you will be assisted by a representative and transferred onto your outbound flight.

tourName: Tahiti Vacation Package for Two: 7 Days of Romance and Leisure
placesVisited: Bora Bora, Motu Piti Aau, Tahiti
generalInfo: Bora Bora is the ultimate island of indulgence in the South Pacific and a getaway spot where all of your senses are subtly aroused. Savor a week of pleasure here at your luxurious five-star suite perched over the kaleidoscope colors of the ocean and within bare-footed access of a virgin white sand beach. With an array of experiences and pleasures for your consideration, this couple’s package showcases why Bora Bora is nature’s great ode to love and a piece of absolute escapism on the edge of the world.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Welcome to Paradise
dayInfo.description: Sweeping views will greet you from the plane window as Bora Bora stands remotely amidst the colors of the South Pacific. The deep green of the ocean blurs into the sapphire of the shore, while the emerald and white of the beaches give the island its distinctive color. The journey here gives an impression of how remote Bora Bora is with virtually nothing within an hour’s flight in any direction. The island is a gem in an archipelago of treasures, and it looks just as your imagination can muster with the rainbow of colors pierced dramatically by the massif of Mount Otemanu. The origins of Bora Bora are unquestionable as the impressive central feature reveals that this is a volcanic island rising interrupted from the ocean deep. A boat is the only means of getting to Motu Piti Aau, the eastern side of the island. Such inaccessibility creates exclusivity, with only the visitors at your resort able to see this part of Bora Bora. The InterContinental Bora Bora Resort & Thalasso Spa is tucked beneath the island’s green volcanic backdrop with coconut palms swaying softly in the ocean breeze. A shallow lagoon stretches out from the white sand beach, its warm waters good for any level of swimmer. This is a stylish five-star resort, yet it also offers a harmony with its surroundings with a Polynesian facade encasing Western luxuries. Check in, relax and unwind as you slowly soak your senses in the surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Settling Into the Island Rhythm
dayInfo.description: A gentle breeze flutters into your villa, bringing with it the soft scent of salt. Floor-to-ceiling windows ensure that you wake up to a view, and it is perhaps the best view in the South Pacific. Beneath you is the lagoon, shimmering through a rainbow of green and blue colors as Mount Otemanu stands proudly, a massif of scorched rock flanked by rugged peaks with slopes coated in moss and trees. The coastline curls around to your left, marked by spiraling palms and swathes of competing green hues. It is the sort of view that makes it worth flying halfway around the world. The resort’s Deep Ocean Spa continues your journey into the island’s rhythm, nestled in tropical gardens with views onto the endless South Pacific. A welcome treatment for couples is included, and while it incorporates modern wellness techniques, there is a strong sense of the traditional. Polynesian healing rituals are integrated, along with nutrients extracted from the depths of the ocean. As you lie on the treatment table, both your body and your mind are gently pummeled by the atmosphere. Open your eyes, and there is more to see as the treatment rooms have a glass bottom so you can watch the tropical marine life flittering past.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Cruising to Hidden Parts of the Island
dayInfo.description: Soft, gentle waters encourage exploration, so you can paddle slowly on a kayak, quickly going past the outer reaches of the resort, onto a coastline that’s completely deserted. Or take a trip in a traditional canoe, the Polynesian vessel that has stood the test of time. Sailing excursions are also a possibility here, either guided or self-guided. You could also try a stand-up paddle board and venture out into the expanses of bliss. As you traverse the waters, you will journey alongside a coastline that is inaccessible by any other means as there are no roads and no jetties for the motorboats to land. You will be completely alone, paddling up to slithers of white sand for a morning or afternoon on what starts to feel like your own private island. Your villa offers a similar feeling of privacy and exclusivity. Villas are perched above the water at the end of a long wooden walkway raised on stilts. Beneath the Polynesian-style wood and thatch facade is a contemporary décor, particularly in the gorgeous bathroom. The bedroom opens onto a living area and dining room, all with the same wonderful views towards Mount Otemanu. In total, the villa measures some 220 square meters, in addition to the 100-square-meter private terrace. Sun loungers are found here and can be placed in the sun or shade whatever the time in the afternoon. Cool off in your private outdoor pool or fresh water shower, or jump into the lagoon at high tide to join the tropical fish that are resident below. The InterContinental Bora Bora Resort is one of French Polynesia’s finest properties, and the Brando Suite is the ultimate of its indulgences.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – A Beautiful Helicopter Tour
dayInfo.description: Bora Bora feels like a lost world with thick jungle amongst its volcanic folds and the mountain peaks a rugged compass point rising vertically in the Pacific. From the water, you can appreciate the swirling hues with so many different shades of green to enjoy. From the air, there is a thrilling window onto the scale of this island paradise. The ocean extends with nothing but deep blue-green framing the panoramas. Beneath the helicopter is the lush exoticism of the forests with so much impenetrable and tangled landscape to admire. Skirting the island are more reefs and beaches with surreal pieces of white and blue illuminated by the sun. After a boat transfer from Motu Piti Aau, you will soar across Bora Bora in a helicopter for a private sightseeing flight that illustrates the complete beauty of your destination and its remarkable isolation. In particular, cruising past the peaks of Mount Otemanu is one of French Polynesia’s most iconic experiences, such an imposing mountain so close to the virgin white sand. Touch down, and the rest of the day is at your leisure with more time to lounge at your villa, listen to the fine sand squeak softly beneath your feet, or take advantage of the activities on the water or at the spa.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Scuba Diving and Snorkeling
dayInfo.description: Beneath the surface, there is a whole world of enchantment as the nutrient-rich volcanic reefs attract a rich variety of resident marine life. Most of the wildlife is small and colorful, distinguished by red gills, strange stripes and marked fins. A coral nursery is protected within the lagoon, home to these tropical schools and an excellent place to snorkel, with or without the assistance of trained marine biologists. A scuba diving school is also located on site, offering dive excursions from the shore as well as those deeper out in the ocean. While these are mostly catered for qualified scuba divers, introductory courses are a possibility should you wish. For some guests, going beneath the surface is a standard part of the days at the resort. For all guests, there’s a wide choice of restaurants and bars to access throughout day and night. Dine casually on the beach, your bare feet settling into the white sand. The Reef Restaurant offers a more stylish affair, mixing the flavors of Mediterranean and Polynesian cuisine. Le Corail Restaurant is the resort’s boutique French-inspired place to dine, where you dress up in evening wear and enjoy a peaceful corner for two. All these restaurants provide an option for you to dine privately on the sand, or on the large dining table in your own villa. And like the choice of where to eat, there’s a host of quiet options of where to drink, from those on the sand to those that make liberal use of Polynesian décor.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Remote Hiking and Biking Trails
dayInfo.description: Sunrise ripples off of the water with the reds and yellows glistening as you pull the curtains aside. Breakfast arrives by canoe, paddled out on the traditional local vessel, delivered with a local Tahitian greeting. Savor that atmosphere and the beautiful breakfast before a morning of adventure in the Bora Bora forests. Extending out from the resort are a number of narrow trails, each passing deeper and deeper into the island’s interior. They will take you beneath the forest canopy and provide shade at almost all hours of the day. Some jut out, intrepid footsteps leading you to a private beach hidden from the world. Others loop onto the hills, where there are relaxed views back over the lagoon. With mountain bikes you can cover more distance, allowing you to discover other sides of the island. Even on foot, it only takes 15 minutes to feel like you are wandering a private garden playground. As with the water sports options, these hiking and cycling trails are regularly used by some guests, especially those who seek a complete sense of solitude. Exclusivity and flexibility is at the core of the experience on Bora Bora, especially at the Intercontinental Bora Bora Resort & Thalasso Spa. This detailed itinerary provides an outline of a couple’s program at the resort, with a suggestion of activities and indulgences that could be included. Every couple is different, and the itinerary on this page is designed to showcase the type of excursions and experiences possible, rather than being a fixed program. When you arrive, it is easy to customize the day to day to your interests and your prevailing mood. Just take off your watch, forget about time, and take in the best of Bora Bora island.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Departure
dayInfo.description: Lie in, take a late breakfast and do not worry about the checking out time. This is Bora Bora, where the atmosphere is much slower than it is at home. You will depart later today but enjoy full use of your villa and the resort’s facilities until departure. It will be a short transfer to the center of the island to meet your onward flight, with the views from the plane window showcasing just how far removed you have been from the world.

tourName: Treasured Gems of Tahiti Vacation Tour: Pearl Farm, Coral Garden & More
generalInfo: Experience both exclusive luxury and enchanting scenery during your customizable Tahiti and Moorea vacation. Sail across the South Pacific in search of whales breaching the sea, bask in the sweet aromas of the abundant tropical fruits, and then float above the blossomed coral gardens as exotic fish glow with kaleidoscopic hues. Whether learning about the historical formation of the islands or gliding down a natural waterslide beneath the rainforest canopy, you can indulge in comfort, bask in secluded beauty, and relish your unforgettable and exotic vacation on the French Polynesian islands of Tahiti and Moorea.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti - Arrive in Papeete and Enjoy a Walking Tour of Tahiti’s Largest City
dayInfo.description: The shoreline of Tahiti will shimmer with black sand and turquoise waters. Coconut palms shade the walkways in Papeete and bring the aroma of luscious fruit drifting with the sea breeze. Jewelers showcase white, green, purple, and black pearls beneath the soft light in private studios as the Central Market brims with gorgeous produce displaying the tropical splendors of island life in French Polynesia. From stunning pineapples to delicate lychee, magnificent coconuts to delicious passion fruit, you will even find sweet potatoes that shine with brilliance. Your flight will land at Faaa International Airport, and your private transfer will greet you upon your arrival. Tahiti is the largest of the French Polynesian islands and encompasses more than 400 square miles. The rainforest at the heart of the island hides magnificent waterfalls, while the coast gives way to hidden beaches and secluded coral gardens. You will find comfort in the gorgeous views and in the contemporary luxuries of your overwater bungalow. Your iconic thatched roof and glass panels create a cozy ambiance as you look out onto the vibrant life of the lagoon. The coral will shine with kaleidoscope hues as they are surrounded by schools of tropical fish, all accentuated by the view from your private terrace. After settling into the pleasures of your resort, you can return to Papeete with your guide for an introductory walking tour of French Polynesia’s largest city. You will begin in the city center where the Municipal Market continues to sing with life. A wooden boardwalk known as the Quay runs along the shoreline and leads to the marina where opulent yachts moor, and you can see the bustling movement in the fishing port along the shores of Motu Uta. Move next to see a traditional pearl farm to learn how the quality of a pearl is measured, and then continue on to the jeweler’s studio to learn more about the craftsmanship and artistry involved.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Relish a Full Day Tour around the Culture and History of Tahiti
