dayInfo.description: Wake up in the secluded splendors of tropical paradise with the sounds of the calm lagoon splashing against the posts of your luxurious bungalow. At breakfast, the vibrant colors of dragon fruit and papaya accentuate the aroma of fresh coffee that is brewed from beans cultivated on the islands of French Polynesia. Your guide will greet you at your hotel after your meal eager to lead you on a tour that will circle the island’s main coastal road. The gorgeous turquoise hues of the lagoon lead to the emerald colors of the tropical rainforest. Before leaving Papeete, you can stop in the Gauguin Museum to view the marvelous collection of works painted by the master French artist who saw the luster of Tahiti. The museum represents the beauty the artist captured during his years on the island, including the sketches and impressionist paintings of exotic flowers blossoming in the gardens. Stop next to visit the Museum of Tahiti and Her Islands for insight into the unique and unforgettable history of the celebrated archipelago. Enter the lobby to find an altar crafted from pure stone and supports a display of traditional statues. The scent of antique wood drifts through the galleries and adds to the ambiance of both the natural and the cultural history. The museum offers concise explanations and interesting artifacts that lead to the arrival of Europeans, along with sections of surfers that shift your focus to the regional culture around the small town of Punaauia. Marvel at the rare collection of art carvings that represent mythological figures and gods.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Delight in an Exciting 4x4 Jeep Expedition through Papenoo Valley
dayInfo.description: The sunlight will shine over the turquoise hues of the lagoon as the rainforest shimmers like a gem with emerald hues. Surfers take to the waves that break just away from the reef at Punaauia, and the scent of pineapple will accompany the decadent aroma of coffee at breakfast. You will meet your guide in a 4x4 jeep to discover the wonders of Tahiti that are hidden by the verdant and lush canopy. On the east coast, the Arahoho Blowhole spouts water through an ancient lava tube. Nearby, beachgoers venture to the gentle curve of the black sand beach at Plage de Taharuu. Your guide will lead you to the Papeeno Valley to reach Lake Vaihiria, and then you can rumble along the unpaved roads, adding to the adventurous spirit in your all-terrain vehicle. Wind along the ridges that frame the valley and splash through the rivers to reach the steep inclines. Remnants of stone temples poke out of the vines and grasses while the foundations of traditional homes represent the valley lifestyle long abandoned. Your guide will stop along the river’s edge where the water has smoothed the basalt riverbed. You can take some time to enjoy the cold rush of the water on your skin and then glide down the decline and plunge into the clear natural pools as ferns and wild guava trees shade the banks of the pool. You will reach the top of the crater to find the green tint of Lake Vaihiria glistening beneath the low trees as wild raspberries grow along the shorelines, hidden in the foliage. You will continue back down the mountain and relish the time you spent in Tahiti’s hidden charms before digging your toes into the soft hot sands of your resort.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Fly to Moorea for a 4x4 Excursion to find Jungle and Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: Moorea embodies the majesty and the magic of a tropical dreamscape. White sand beaches surround emerald rainforests and coconut palms tower over indigo lagoons. Trails wind through the jungle terrain, and coral gardens glow with radiant hues inside the warm, inviting waters. After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you to the airport for a brief flight to Moorea. The short distance will allow you to look down over the clear cobalt waters of the Sea of Moons, the 11-mile wide strait that separates Tahiti from Moorea. You can see the reef bodies inside the crystal clear lagoon as sporadic overwater bungalows rise out of the shallow sea. Your private transfer will escort you from the airport to the comforts of your private resort and your luxurious overwater bungalow. A glass panel in the floor will allow you to watch the fish swimming in the lagoon below. After you settle in, you will meet your guide in the lobby to begin your excursion into the heart of the island on a 4x4 jeep expedition. The grasslands feed into the lush forest and the jagged basalt peak of Mount Rotui, which reaches 3,200 feet above sea level. Traverse the jungle terrain to reach the Belvedere Lookout located at the end of the road with a view of Opunohu Bay. The fresh air fills with the aroma of blossoming hibiscus as the breeze rustles the tall grass that drapes over the summit. You will have an unfettered view of the verdant jungle that overtakes the mountains and is framed by the shifting hues of Cook and Oponohu Bays. Return to the resort in the evening, and listen to the captivating rhythms that begin with your dinner and finish through a dance show that will feature the traditional sounds and movements of the islands.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Discover the Splendor of the Lagoon with a Full Day Snorkel Tour
dayInfo.description: The sunlight will spread across Moorea with a breeze that carries the aromas of vanilla and dried pineapple. Sweet homemade jams adorn a stand outside of the Tropical Gardens while the farmland cultivates breadfruit and lychee, guava and coconut against a backdrop of the open South Pacific. The dining room fills with the refreshing aroma of decadent coffee for breakfast, and after the meal, you can meet your guide at your resort’s private dock to begin your stunning discovery of the lagoon beneath the surface. The wind will rush through your hair and across the fronds of the towering coconut palms and from the boat, the inland rainforest will look more like green velvet. You will find the aroma of hibiscus blending with the briny scent of the lagoon while you weight anchor around the edge of a coral garden that is blooming with vibrant colors and unique, twisting calcite formations. The sporadic mounds of coral near your overwater bungalow turn into a long stretch of rainbow hues from the coral that resembles budding roses, small tables, and unique pillars. Lemonpeel angelfish swim near purple mounds to contrast the darker hues with vibrant yellow scales. The fish have a blue ring around their eyes and can grow to nearly five inches long. The current will carry you away to find two marvelous rays swimming along the sandy seafloor. Their wingspan can grow to a width of 23 feet, while a giant clam hides amidst the coral and occasionally opens to show sparkling blue and white design. You can admire the natural splendor that thrives in the warm, crystal clear waters and reveals itself with a flash of gorgeous color and vibrant life.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Venture onto the South Pacific with a Whale Watching Excursion
dayInfo.description: The enticing and luscious aroma of coconut blends with the scent of blossoming hibiscus. You can slowly wake as you listen to the water lapping against the posts of your bungalow and watch the fish scurry beneath the glass floor panel at the center of your suite. Nearby, the jagged peaks soar above the emerald jungle as the sunlight returns the sheen to the translucent lagoon. After breakfast, you will board your boat at the marina and venture out into the waters in search of dolphins and whales. Your guide is a certified conservationist and researcher eager to share his knowledge of the open water and island shores. Your guide will share the legends of the formation of Moorea in equal parts with the geological explanation of the island’s natural history. Sporadic mist will splash against your cheeks and leave salt crystals on your skin as your guide will point over the boat as a collection of dorsal fins rise out of the water from a pod of pilot whales. Their black, glossy skin will glint in the sunlight as they arch out of the water. They have an anchor-shaped light patch beneath their chin and can grow to nearly 24 feet long. The whales will click their teeth and whistle while foraging and show signs closely related to dolphins before your guide will explain that pilot whales are in fact the among the largest of oceanic dolphins. You will stay on the water not much longer before a pod of spinner dolphins will appear, flipping like acrobats out of the blue South Pacific.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you will find the scent of coconut milk will compliment the aroma of freshly brewed coffee. The flavors marry well together amidst the vibrant hues of dragon fruit, mango, and papaya that decorate your plate. Nearby, beachgoers lay blankets over the white sands of Taahiamanu Beach and bask in the tropical sunlight while the coral reef glows in the water with gorgeous, arching branches and curious tropical fish that help keep the waves small and gentle. After one last leisurely morning, your private transfer will greet you in the lobby and escort you to the Moorea Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Two-Week Island Paradise Vacation: Honeymooning in Tahiti
generalInfo: The islands of French Polynesia welcome you to an idyllic tropical paradise during this customizable 14-day Tahiti honeymoon. This tour is designed for you to discover the luxury, charm, and natural splendor of the South Pacific. Whether looking for the mystical allure of a lagoon that shines with four shades of blue, to lounge in the white sands of a secluded beach, or to indulge in a romantic couple’s massage among the sound of the lapping waves, this Tahiti honeymoon immerses you in the majesty of tropical islands.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Arrival and Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: Tahiti is the largest island of the French Polynesian archipelago and brims with exotic aromas. Your flight will land at Faa’a International Airport in Papeete, where your private transfer will meet you at customs. You will arrive at your stunning resort, where you can relax in your private overwater bungalow and listen to the sounds of the serene lagoon as it laps against the support beams. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to bask in the beauty of Tahiti and the romance of your honeymoon.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Tahiti Snorkeling Tour
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will meet your guide and venture into the waters of Tahiti for a snorkeling tour. This tour will allow you to search for the exotic colors of coral reefs and tropical marine life. Your guided tour will act as an introduction to the beauty of the world around French Polynesia. Moray eels will peer out at the world from inside crevices, and bright-orange clownfish will hide within the glowing anemones. After exploring the marine world of Tahiti, you can venture to the Belvedere, which is located approximately 2,000 feet above the town of Papeete. The incredible views sweep across the layers of blue water and the jade foliage of the island of Moorea.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Waterfalls and Culture
dayInfo.description: Your excursion around the island will begin early with your guide meeting you in the lobby. You will make your way to the village of Tiarei and a black-sand beach. You will follow the trail into the jungle terrain to reach the fascinating Faarumai Waterfalls. Natural pools and lava tubes populate the meandering Fautaua Valley among the aromas of blossoming hibiscus. You will continue to the stunning Jardin Botaniques, where your guide will help you discover the garden, ponds, and palms that are representative of the dynamic tropical foliage of French Polynesia.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Another Snorkeling Tour
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will make your way on a quick ferry to the nearby island of Moorea. Upon your arrival, your transfer will escort you to your secluded overwater bungalow. After settling into the luxuries of your overwater bungalow, your guide will introduce you to the marvelous lagoons of Moorea during a private snorkeling tour. The water will be calm and accessible. The sandy floor will give way to the mounds of coral that create pockets of maritime knolls. During this experience, you will be able to find an incredible variety of sea life.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – 4WD Excursion & Helicopter Tour
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will set out into the wilderness of Moorea on a half-day tour to discover the diverse beauty of the island, from the shoreline to the mountain peaks of the tropical getaway. The stunning colors of the lagoon will shine a vibrant turquoise in the morning light. Your guide will lead you from the ringing coastal road to the base of Magic Mountain. The steep road will lead you to a marvelous lookout at approximately 685 feet above sea level. Afterward, you will continue to the airfield for your helicopter tour of the island. You will spend up to 20 minutes in the air for the best views of Opunohu Bay.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Private Catamaran Tour
dayInfo.description: You will start your day with a journey into the open waters of Moorea in search of passing whales and dolphins. The majestic humpback whale passes between the French Polynesian islands when migrating, giving birth, or feeding on the local krill. From July to early November, you can spot the captivating mammals as they swim in the South Pacific. The beauty of Moorea and the fabulous images of the bay will become even more apparent during your luxurious catamaran tour. This evening, you will board a luxurious sailboat for a private exploration of the Opunohu Bay.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Relax on the Famous Beaches
dayInfo.description: On your last day in Moorea, you can bask in the beauty of the island at your leisure and indulge in the white-sand beaches at your preferred pace. After breakfast, you can make your way to the sands of Teavora. Surfers will carve the break with exceptional skill, and the golden sunlight will wash over the white sand. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to embrace Moorea as you desire. For a soothing and romantic experience in Moorea, you can partake in a couples massage in an open-air spa.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Another Day at the Beach
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private transfer will escort you back to Tahiti and the Faa’a Airport for a quick flight to Bora Bora. Upon your arrival, you will have the opportunity to relax in the comforts of your overwater bungalow. After enjoying the luxuries of your accommodation, you can make your way to the island for a discovery of the sensational sands of Bora Bora. You can find pristine white sands that are lined by lush jungle and elegant palm trees. As one of the most beautiful beaches in French Polynesia, the coastline boasts powdery sands with crystal-clear water.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Cycling Excursion around Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you can enjoy the subtle aroma of vanilla as it sweeps into your overwater suite. After breakfast, you can partake in a bicycle ride around the island at your preferred pace. You can follow the island’s nearly 20 miles of coastal road to discover the tropical island paradise. You can make your way up the hillside to the coastal guns, where you can find the remaining coastal defense guns and concrete bunker from the Second World War. The marvelous vista overlooks the lagoon and white sands of the protruding motu . Upon returning to your resort, you can relax with a spa treatment.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – The Marvelous Island Water
dayInfo.description: You will discover the underwater marvels of Bora Bora with a private snorkel tour that will take you to the magnificent coral gardens after breakfast. Your guide will meet you in the resort lobby and escort you along the water so that you can peer into the crystal-clear lagoon. The hard coral will protrude from the soft sand like miniature mountains and host an abundance of marine life. You will continue to a point that is known for hosting blacktip reef sharks and stingrays. The stunning collection of marine life swims near the coral but stays close to the soft sands of the seafloor.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a �– Traditional Dance Lesson
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will have a special breakfast delivered to your overwater bungalow. You will be serenaded by Polynesian song as a ceremonial canoe arrives. As the attendants set up your breakfast in your suite, you can enjoy a quick exploration of the lagoon in the canoe, which will allow the elegant sea air to awaken your senses. You will then arrive on the island of Raiatea after a brief flight. Your private transfer will meet you at the airport and escort you by boat to your resort on the neighboring island of Taha’a. In the afternoon, you will partake in a private lesson that will offer you insight into the history, heritage, and movement of Tahitian dance.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – The History and Heritage of Taha’a
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will lead you on a tour that will uncover the marvelous history and heritage of Taha’a, beginning with a visit into the lush valleys of watermelon, bananas, and coconut groves. When visiting a local plantation, your guide will explain how the vanilla orchid arrived on the island and why each flower must be pollinated by hand. You will then taste the vanilla to find hints of chocolate and caramel in the depth of flavor. You will then continue to Haamaene Bay, where you will meet with local pearl farmers who are known for harvesting elegant black pearls.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Unique Island Tour
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will take a boat to Raiatea for your unique tour of the neighboring islands. You will gain a sense of the distinctive heritage of French Polynesia at Marae Taputapuatea , which is a large sacred stone complex that once supported the central temple of Eastern Polynesia. The religious site once brought chiefs from across the Polynesian world to the island. Upon returning to Taha’a, you will enjoy another opportunity to snorkel in the water of French Polynesia. Your guide will take you to the coral garden that is situated in a channel.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will enjoy the service of breakfast as it is delivered to your room for one last time. The scent of vanilla will be seductive and inescapable in the early light, and your private transfer will meet you in the lobby. Shortly, you will return to the island of Raiatea by boat before flying to Tahiti. You will have plenty of time to connect with your flight home once at the airport in Tahiti.
